programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: BYU (18-8, 8-5) comes off a 91-57 upset of No. 23 Kansas; No. 19 Arizona (18-8, 12-3) is 11-2 at home this season, and beat the Cougars, 85-74, on Feb. 4 behind 18 points from Caleb Love and 17 from both Jaden Bradley and Henri Veesaar.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 15 Missouri (20-6, 9-4) comes off a 110-98 win over No. 4 Alabama, and defeated the Razorbacks, 83-65, on Jan. 18 behind Mark Mitchell and Caleb Grill; Arkansas (15-11, 4-9) dropped its last two games, but is 10-4 at home this season.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: North Carolina claimed a 79-68 victory over Louisville in their lone meeting from the 2023-24 season on Jan. 21, 2024, led by Deja Kelly's 23 points and 6 assists; Nyla Harris posted 16 points and 3 rebounds for the Cardinals in the road loss.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Notre Dame claimed a 55-51 victory over North Carolina State in the 2024 ACC Championship game on March 10, led by Hannah Hidalgo's 22 points and 6 assists; Maddy Westbeld added 16 points and 7 rebounds for the Fighting Irish in the win.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: The GameDay crew goes on the road to various locations at different campuses across the country and discusses the biggest games of the week, while evaluating player performances; experts weigh in on trending topics and teams throughout the nation.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: LSU claimed a 77-56 victory over Kentucky in their lone meeting from the 2023-24 season on March 3 behind 22 points and 14 rebounds from Angel Reese; Flau'jae Johnson added 21 points and 7 rebounds for the Tigers in the win at home.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.desc: Minnesota enters the series having claimed a 116-101 victory over Oklahoma City in their most recent meeting on Feb. 13 behind Naz Reid's 27 points and 13 rebounds; Shai Gilgeous-Alexander posted 24 points and 9 assists for the Thunder's road loss.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Minnesota enters the series having claimed a 116-101 victory over Oklahoma City in their most recent meeting on Feb. 13 behind Naz Reid's 27 points and 13 rebounds; Shai Gilgeous-Alexander posted 24 points and 9 assists for the Thunder's road loss.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Cleveland claimed victories over Memphis in both of their meetings from the 2023-24 season, winning the final matchup on Apr. 10 with a 110-98 scoreline; Donovan Mitchell posted 29 points and 8 assists for the Cavaliers in the win at home.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Washington is 6-1-3 over its last 10 games and won its last meeting with the Penguins, 4-1, at home on Jan. 18; Pittsburgh is 1-5-0 in its last six meetings with the Capitals at PPG Paints Arena, and the Penguins are 4-9-4 against division rivals.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Minnesota is 20-7-3 on the road this season but has lost its last two visits to Little Caesars Arena; Detroit is 7-2-1 over its last 10 games and had a seven-game winning streak end with its 6-3 loss to Tampa Bay before the break.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Florida Atlantic (15-11, 8-5) had its five-win streak snapped by Wichita State, 75-68; No. 22 Memphis (21-5, 11-2) is 10-2 at home behind PJ Haggerty, who is second in the AAC with 21.2 ppg, and beat the Owls, 90-62, on Jan. 2 behind Tyrese Hunter.

programme.title: ESPN Original Documentaries
programme.desc: An inside look is taken at the 1991 Michigan Wolverines basketball team and the immediate impact five highly touted freshmen made on the college basketball landscape, featuring Juwan Howard, Jimmy King, Ray Jackson, Jalen Rose and Chris Webber.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Saint Mary's (24-4, 14-1) won its last four games, and beat the Bulldogs, 62-58, on Feb. 1 behind 16 points from Mikey Lewis; Gonzaga (21-7, 12-3) won five-straight games, and is 12-1 at home behind Graham Ike, who is fourth in WCC scoring.

programme.title: The Undefeated
programme.desc: The new multimedia platform coming to the networks helps examine the intersections of sports, race and culture through long and short-form stories and features that help show how the issues have progressed over the years and their effect.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: West Virginia claimed victories over TCU in both of their meetings from the 2023-24 season, winning the final matchup on March 2 with a 57-49 scoreline; Jordan Harrison and Ja'Naiya Quinerly both had 14 points for the Mountaineers in the win.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: The top collegiate hip hop dancing squads from across the country compete for the UDA national title, showcasing their skills and choreography to a panel of judges at the annual event who grade their performances under certain criteria.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Cal (12-14, 5-10) is 2-9 away from home despite Andrej Stojakovic; Stanford (16-10, 8-7) is 13-2 at home, and won its last three meetings with the Golden Bears after an 89-81 win on Dec. 7 behind 20 points from Maxime Raynaud and Jaylen Blakes.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Drake (24-3, 14-3) is top five in the country in scoring defense, and won eight of the last 10 meetings after a 66-52 win on Jan. 29 behind 20 points from Bennett Stirtz, who leads MVC scoring; Northern Iowa (19-9, 13-4) won six-straight games.

programme.title: Skate for LA Strong - Charity Hockey Game
programme.desc: The NHL's Los Angeles Kings host a fundraising game featuring celebrities and first responders to benefit those affected by the wildfires in Southern California through the LA Fire Relief Fund; teams battle through the semifinals and Championship.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Ron Shelton takes an in-depth look back at the motivations that led Michael Jordan to quit playing for the Chicago Bulls and pursue a career in professional baseball despite having just won three consecutive championships in the NBA.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: WNBA superstar and activist Maya Moore stepped away from the sport for a remarkable reason: to fight for a man she believed was wrongly imprisoned, devoting herself full-time to working for the release of a man named Jonathan Irons.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: Tony Finau signed a one-match to compete for Los Angeles Golf Club (2-0-1), which is currently second in the season standings with five points; New York Golf Club (1-2-0) comes off its first win after trouncing Jupiter Links GC, 10-3, on Feb. 18.

programme.desc: The latest news and reports surrounding the X Games and athlete-focused content is featured, including profiles of the top athletes and artists, previews of the biggest events, special documentaries, and recaps of major events.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Vancouver Canucks were one win from becoming the first Canadian team to win a Stanley Cup title since 1993, but a loss to the Chicago Blackhawks in Game 7 of the 2011 Stanley Cup Final caused unrest among the home fans, leading to a massive riot.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: Behind captain Mark Messier and goalie Mark Richter, the New York Rangers were in prime position in 1994 to give the team their first Stanley Cup title since 1940, using inspiration from paralyzed NYPD officer Steven McDonald to make their run.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: Boston Common Golf (0-2-1) seeks its first win after suffering its second one-shot defeat in a 5-4 loss to The Bay Golf Club on Feb. 17; Atlanta Drive GC (2-1-0) is third in the standings after falling to The Bay Golf Club, 6-5, on Feb. 17.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Kansas State beat Baylor, 58-55, in their lone meeting of the 2023-24 season in Jan. 2024, led by 16 points from each of Serena Sundell, Gabby Gregory and Eliza Maupin; the Bears' Bella Fontleroy had 12 points while Aijha Blackwell added 11 rebounds.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. reveals the second edition of his mock 2025 NFL Draft, going over the changes he made from his inaugural mock, the players that are rising and falling on his board, along with the best fits for teams looking to address needs.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa State claimed a 67-62 victory over Baylor in the 2024 Big 12 Championship quarter-finals round on March 9, led by Audi Crooks' 23 points and 6 rebounds; Dre'Nna Edwards posted 17 points and 7 rebounds for the Bears in the loss.

programme.title: Inside the Big East
programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.title: Fox College Hoops Tip-off
programme.desc: Expert analysts evaluate matchups and breakdown the upcoming college basketball game; coverage includes highlights of games from around the country, exclusive interviews with players and coaches, special features and human interest stories.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Oregon (19-8, 8-8) won its last three games after an 80-78 win over Iowa; No. 11 Wisconsin (21-5, 11-4) won five-straight games, and is 13-1 at home this season behind John Tonje, who is tied for third in Big Ten scoring with 19.6 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Xavier (17-10, 9-7) won three-straight games, and won four of the last five meetings after a 94-72 win on Dec. 31 behind 22 points from Ryan Conwell; Seton Hall (7-19, 2-13) dropped 10 of its last 11 games, but has five wins at home, going 5-8.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova and Providence split wins in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season, with the Wildcats winning the final matchup on Feb. 21, 2024, with a 68-58 scoreline; Lucy Olsen posted 30 points and 5 assists for Villanova in the home win.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: Season begins with 2025 FXR Pro Fish Bassmaster Elite at St. Johns River, with Greg Hackney (who was 2nd at St. Johns in 2016 and 2021), Easton Fothergill, Jeff Gustafson, Jason Williamson, Justin Hammer, Takumi Ito, and Keith Combs among anglers.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Butler (12-14, 5-10) is 1-7 on the road, but won 21 of the last 22 meetings with the Blue Demons after an 86-69 win on Jan. 25 behind Pierre Brooks II; DePaul (11-16, 2-14) dropped its last four games, but is 10-7 at home this season.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim opened the 2025 season with a victory at Daytona to gain an early three-point lead over defending champion Ty Majeski; Kyle Busch averaged 111.425 mph en route to his win at Atlanta last year, beating Majeski by 0.187 seconds.

programme.title: Pickleball
programme.desc: The James has been named the official and exclusive hospital of the upcoming 2024 APP Vlasic Classic in Cincinnati on May 7-12.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 3 Duke (23-3) won three-straight games after an 80-62 win over Virginia behind 17 points and 14 rebounds from Cooper Flagg, who is third in ACC scoring with 19.7 ppg; Illinois (17-10) dropped its last two games, both to ranked opponents.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: USC (14-12, 6-9) dropped four of its last five after an 88-71 loss to Maryland; Rutgers (13-14, 6-10) ended a three-game skid with an 89-85 OT win over Washington, and is 9-4 at home behind Dylan Harper, who leads the team in scoring with 19.2 ppg.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Illinois is coming off of a 70-55 defeat to UCLA on Feb. 20 with 18 points from Adalia Mckenzie and 11 rebounds by Kendall Bostic; USC beat Michigan State, 83-75, on Feb. 19, led by JuJu Watkins' 28 points and Rayah Marshall's 12 rebounds.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim opened the 2025 season with a victory at Daytona to gain an early three-point lead over defending champion Ty Majeski; Kyle Busch averaged 111.425 mph en route to his win at Atlanta last year, beating Majeski by 0.187 seconds.

programme.desc: The 2024 Ambetter Health 400 made sure the follow-up to the opening Daytona 500 would be a memorable one, as Daniel Suarez, Ryan Blaney and Kyle Busch would put together the closest three-wide photo finish in NASCAR Cup Series history.

programme.desc: The top competitors from around the world compete in the AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series, the premier snowmobile racing event in North America, featuring racers competing on a track with big jumps, highlights of top moments and interviews.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: North Queensland (0-0-1) defeated the Storm in Round 26 last season with a 38-30 victory in Round 26, as Kyle Feldt scored two tries in the first half, while Valentine Holmes had 18 points; Melbourne (0-0-1) fell to New Zealand, 36-10, on Feb. 14.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Ittihad progressed past Al-Hilal in the King's Cup quarter-finals round on Jan. 7 after penalties of a 2-2 draw where forward Karim Benzema equalized for Al-Ittihad in the 24th minute of extra time; Benzema had a brace in the single-leg cup match.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Haiti U20 (1-0-0) overcame an early one-goal deficit to secure a 3-1 triumph over Antigua and Barbuda U20 in Week 1, as Pierreline Nazon notched a brace; Belize U20 (0-1-0) comes off a scoreless draw with Guyana U20 on Feb. 21; first-ever meeting.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Minnesota and Los Angeles split victories in theri two meetings from the 2024 season with LAFC claiming a 2-0 victory in the final matchup on May 29; Denis Bouanga converted a penalty and Mateusz Bogusz made it a 2-0 lead in the second half.
